Only to know, this feature will work with spark and prestodb?

Thank you

> Sorry for the long delay here. this sort of unification makes sense. I ll track this to completion. I am also thinking of introducing a `HoodieSchema` abstraction to begin with. let me think this through more.

Hi, @vinothchandar good point for `HoodieSchema`, about this topic, we may need to think with [RFC-33](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/HUDI/RFC+-+33++Hudi+support+more+comprehensive+Schema+Evolution). WDYT?

Big yes to that :) . Please let me know if I can help for anything.

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HUDI-2370 @yanghua  Here are some discussions

Thank you vc, work hard together

@vinothchandar did you solve your problem? did you solve your problem? can you use Apache Hudi 0.9.0 with hive 3.x?
I'm fine with the change, but i'm not familiar with the kerbrous thing, assumes that the author has tested it locally, @vinothchandar , do you want to take a look ?
Hi Team, following up on the ticket to check if there is any update.
Why close the PR, i opened it for our users to use for 0.9.0 version.
I did not have the context. I closed since the release is done. Feel free to reopen if you'd like
@umehrot2 @zhedoubushishi could you please take a first pass

Hi @nsivabalan, 

After some other testing, we figured out what was our problem.
Based on the AWS recommendation, we were wrongly assuming that the any memory parameter passed on the glue spark context were being automatically replaced by Glue. (Like some indicators showed us on SparkUI), but, in some ways this parameters were affecting in a negative way the Glue native memory management.

Basically, removing all the manual memory settings (like memory and memory overhead) on our glue spark context made the jobs running properly without any memory issues. (We also tested the same jobs with the double of the files and with fewer machines, and it also worked well)

Thank you for help on this case.
@vinothchandar - yes, good idea, created this [HUDI-2407](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HUDI-2407) Jira to track this work.

the code looks good, my last comment was confirming that we should use '%s' so that the String.format function in the L197 will replace it correctly.

No further changes are required by @pratyakshsharma!

Hi @nsivabalan,  I was looking @ some assistance on this.
I have followed all the optimization provided in https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/plugins/servlet/mobile?contentId=115510763#content/view/115510763  but then too .....Hudi insert of 53 GB gzip file in a fairly large EMR : 
Cluster Size:1 Master (m5.xlarge) node , 2* (r5a.24xlarge) core nodes and 6 * (r5a.24xlarge) is taking almost 2 hrs. 

I have given the all the details above.
Sorry, I accidentally deleted the question about kerberos connection failure, I will answer it again here

> Sorry, I accidentally deleted the question about kerberos connection failure, I will answer it again here
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/90183930/132628156-d810980c-107d-4745-ae8a-8bf01380ad35.png)
This is the code I tested to connect to Kerberos-managed Hive in two ways
1. Add the hive - site. XML
2. Do not add hive-site.xml
Both methods have been tested to create a database for Kerberos-managed Hive
So there is no problem with either method

To connect to Kerberos-managed Hive, you need to perform the following operations
1. Perform Kerberos authentication on the client
2. When calling hive.get (conf).getmsc (),Pass the conf. Set (" hive. Metastore. Sasl. Enabled ", "true") and the conf. Set (" hive. Metastore. Kerberos. Principal ","hive/_HOST@BIGDATA");
3. Ensure that the Hive client version is the same as the Hive server version
**Note that the principal is set to the principal used by the hive being accessed**
@hudi-bot run azure

Did we think about removing the `hbase-server` from the `hudi-common` module? It's a big dependency. some ideas e.g. copy the HFile related source code or move relevant features into a non-core module or shaded it thoroughly into a third-party module like [this](https://github.com/trinodb/trino-hive-apache).
@zhangyue19921010 IMO, it's not a minor change. It is worth creating a ticket.

@xiarixiaoyao Taking another look! thanks for the prompt changes!

Hi  @danny0405 as mentioned my use case is purely batch....does Flink Hudi is for streaming or batch?
Moreover my core application is on Spark hence wanted to go with Spark only .

> @zhedoubushishi we already have a hudi.properties file. Can you please elaborate the use case for this PR once?

Sorry for the late reply. This is not the same as ```hudi.properties```. ```hudi.properties``` is created when customers write a Hudi table and it's a table level configuration. 

However, the external configuration file in this PR is not specific to any Hudi table. It's more like a cluster level configuration just like ```spark-defaults.conf``` in Spark and ```flink-conf. yaml``` in Flink. The benefit of having this external configuration file, is there are some configurations can be shared between different Hudi tables, e.g. Hive JDBC URL, Zookeeper connect URL, HBase URL...
+1 on the ticket. This is something we have discussed at length. Copying the source code, seems like a moot point. We just have to shade it more completely.

I see same error when I try to read MOR table using pyspark. No issues querying using hive/presto.

`Spark 3.0.1 and hudi-spark3-bundle_2.12:0.9.0`

Reading as 
```python
queryHudiRead = spark.read.format("org.apache.hudi").load("s3://bucket/table")
queryHudiRead.show()
```

```bash
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
```
@hudi-bot run azure

Yeah, Spark is good for batch case, but the Bloom index is not vary stable when you updates are kind of random(for target partitions), if the BloomFilter got false positive, hoodie would scan the whole parquet file which is the reason why it is slow.

Sure, just create a ticket https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HUDI-2409
Let fix this HBase dependency issue together ! 
By the way, HBase officially provides the hbase-shaded-server version -> https://github.com/apache/hbase/tree/master/hbase-shaded

Thanks @codope for your work!
The most relevant part of the tests got included with #2927
Thanks for adding the other part!

Hi @danny0405 can you explain a bit more on "if the BloomFilter got false positive"?  
In my case the record key is concat(uuid4,segmentId). SegmentId is an integer value i.e. it can be same for multiple records and uuid4 is standard unique random value ( note: "-" are being removed from the uuid4 values though), but a combination of both identifies a record uniquely and partition key is again segmentId  as it has low cardinality.
Got it, please resolve the conflicts and we can start review then. :)
@vinothchandar Please take a look. Fixed all the broken links now.

Hey hi @Ambarish-Giri : 
For initial bulk loading of data into hudi, you can try "bulk_insert" operation. it is expected to be faster compared to regular operations. Ensure you set the right value for [avg record size config](https://hudi.apache.org/docs/configurations/#hoodiecopyonwriterecordsizeestimate) . for subsequent operations, hudi will infer the record size from older commits. But for first commit (bulk import/bulk_insert), hudi relies on this config to pack records to right sized files. 

Couple of questions before we dive into perf in detail: 
1. may I know whats your upsert characteristics? Is it spread across all partitions, or just very few recent partitions. 
2. Does your record key have any timestamp affinity or characteristics. If record keys are completely random, we can try SIMPLE index, since bloom may not be very effective for completely random keys.

If you wish to dedup with bulk_insert, we also need to set "hoodie.combine.before.insert" to true. 
Just to clarify, bulk_insert will not looking into any records in storage at all. so setting this config, will ensure incoming batch is deduped and written to hudi. 
In other words, if you do 2 bulk_inserts, one followed by another, each batch will write unique records to hudi, but if there are records overlapping between batch 1 and batch2, bulk_insert may not update it. 

hope that clarifies.
awesome, thnx for the update.
